translations: （液体）渗漏，渗透；逐渐移动，渐渐散开

sentences.sentence: Many of us thrive on competition, but it can seep into areas of our lives where we do not want it.
sentences.translation: 我们许多人靠竞争而发展，但竞争也会逐渐侵入到我们生活中不需要它的一些方面。

sentences.sentence: The very reason that clichés so easily seep into our speech and writing—their insidious memorability—is exactly why they played such an important role in oral storytelling.
sentences.translation: 陈词滥调之所以如此容易渗透到我们的演讲和写作中，是由于它们潜在的可记忆性，这正是它们在口述故事中扮演如此重要角色的原因。

sentences.sentence: Blood was beginning to seep through the bandages.
sentences.translation: 血开始从绷带上渗出来。
